channel.title: God's Mac

image.title: God's Mac
image.description: God's Mac is where technology meets eternity. Reviewing technology, mostly Apple products, and applying the Christian faith to technology is our purpose. Gabe Taviano is a Macromedia Flash web designer by trade. The show originates from Columbus, Ohio.

channel.itunes:author: Gabe Taviano
channel.itunes:subtitle: God's Mac is where technology meets eternity. With each episode we take time to understand how we can let God shine through technology. A review of Apple news, exciting interviews, and a faith based conclusion. Visit us online @ www.GodsMac.com.

item.title: #56 - Laura Wilkinson
item.description: Laura Wilkinson created one of the most memorable Olympic moments. God's using Laura today through speaking, involvement in the U.S. Diving Program, and building a world-class training facility. Hear how technology supports the platform she's been given.
item.itunes:author: Gabe Taviano, Lee Love and Kary Oberbrunner
item.itunes:subtitle: Laura Wilkinson created one of the most memorable Olympic moments. God's using Laura today through speaking, involvement in the U.S. Diving Program, and building a world-class training facility. Hear how technology supports the platform she's been given.
item.itunes:summary: Laura Wilkinson created one of the most memorable Olympic moments. God's using Laura today through speaking, involvement in the U.S. Diving Program, and building a world-class training facility. Hear how technology supports the platform she's been given.

item.title: #55 - God's Mac 2.0
item.description: We welcome you to the new, shorter podcast format and improved website at GodsMac.com! We've taken some time to re-focus the mission of the podcast, and believe that it will be a service that you'll get much more out of. Thanks for listening!
item.itunes:author: Gabe Taviano, Lee Love and Kary Oberbrunner
item.itunes:subtitle: We welcome you to the new, shorter podcast format and improved website at GodsMac.com! We've taken some time to re-focus the mission of the podcast, and believe that it will be a service that you'll get much more out of. Thanks for listening!
item.itunes:summary: We welcome you to the new, shorter podcast format and improved website at GodsMac.com! We've taken some time to re-focus the mission of the podcast, and believe that it will be a service that you'll get much more out of. Thanks for listening!

item.title: #54 - Brandon Riley
item.description: Brandon Riley shares how God is using his creative talents in Sugar Land, Texas. Gabe and Lee jump into discussion on both old and new technologies, and Kary Oberbrunner joins Gabe as they discuss many misconceptions that the church has regarding women.
item.itunes:author: Gabe Taviano, Lee Love and Kary Oberbrunner
item.itunes:subtitle: Brandon Riley shares how God is using his creative talents in Sugar Land, Texas. Gabe and Lee jump into discussion on both old and new technologies, and Kary Oberbrunner joins Gabe as they discuss many misconceptions that the church has regarding women.
item.itunes:summary: Brandon Riley shares how God is using his creative talents in Sugar Land, Texas. Gabe and Lee jump into discussion on both old and new technologies, and Kary Oberbrunner joins Gabe as they discuss many misconceptions that the church has regarding women.

item.title: #53 - Michael Hyatt
item.description: Michael Hyatt, CEO of Thomas Nelson, joins us this week and discusses an array of subjects, including social media, blogging, and publishing. Gabe and Lee dialogue on tech, while Kary Oberbrunner joins us for a discussion on free will and predestination.
item.itunes:author: Gabe Taviano, Lee Love and Kary Oberbrunner
item.itunes:subtitle: Michael Hyatt, CEO of Thomas Nelson, joins us this week and discusses an array of subjects, including social media, blogging, and publishing. Gabe and Lee dialogue on tech, while Kary Oberbrunner joins us for a discussion on free will and predestination.
item.itunes:summary: Michael Hyatt, CEO of Thomas Nelson, joins us this week and discusses an array of subjects, including social media, blogging, and publishing. Gabe and Lee dialogue on tech, while Kary Oberbrunner joins us for a discussion on free will and predestination.

item.title: #52 - The Sticks Conference and Charles Hill
item.description: Charles Hill joins us this week and discusses The Sticks conference and his move from Ohio to Salt Lake City, Utah. We review online video with Boxee.tv, the Safari 4 browser, and urge our listening audience to follow Lee on Twitter!
item.itunes:author: Gabe Taviano and Lee Love
item.itunes:subtitle: Charles Hill joins us this week and discusses The Sticks conference and his move from Ohio to Salt Lake City, Utah. We review online video with Boxee.tv, the Safari 4 browser, and urge our listening audience to follow Lee on Twitter!

item.title: #51 - BibleTech Conference
item.description: J.D. Elgin, with BibleTech Conference, joins us this week. Join us in Seattle on March 27-28th for the conference! Gabe will be speaking there. Final Draft AV and TweetDeck reviews, and a discussion on the future of Christian conferences and their focus.
item.itunes:author: Gabe Taviano and Lee Love
item.itunes:subtitle: J.D. Elgin, with BibleTech Conference, joins us this week. Join us in Seattle on March 27-28th for the conference! Gabe will be speaking there. Final Draft AV and TweetDeck reviews, and a discussion on the future of Christian conferences and their focus.
item.itunes:summary: J.D. Elgin, with BibleTech Conference, joins us this week. Join us in Seattle on March 27-28th for the conference! Gabe will be speaking there. Final Draft AV and TweetDeck reviews, and a discussion on the future of Christian conferences and their focus.

item.title: #50 - Sam Soffes
item.description: Sam Soffes, LifeChurch.tv developer, has been instrumental in the development of the YouVersion.com online Bible and iPhone application. We review the BlacX hard-drive dock, some nice WordPress plugins, and conclude by discussing the economic crisis.
item.itunes:author: Gabe Taviano and Lee Love
item.itunes:subtitle: Sam Soffes, LifeChurch.tv developer, has been instrumental in the development of the YouVersion.com online Bible and iPhone application. We review the BlacX hard-drive dock, some nice WordPress plugins, and conclude by discussing the economic crisis.

item.title: Christmas Episode - Logos Bible Software
item.description: Merry Christmas from God's Mac! We're excited to partner and interview Logos Bible Software. They are extending a 25% discount on their Bible study software. Call Logos at 1-800-875-6467 or use the coupon code "GODSMAC" when ordering online at Logos.com.
item.itunes:author: Gabe Taviano
item.itunes:subtitle: Merry Christmas from God's Mac! We're excited to partner and interview Logos Bible Software. They are extending a 25% discount on their Bible study software. Call Logos at 1-800-875-6467 or use the coupon code "GODSMAC" when ordering online at Logos.com.
item.itunes:summary: Merry Christmas from God's Mac! We're excited to partner and interview Logos Bible Software. They are extending a 25% discount on their Bible study software. Call Logos at 1-800-875-6467 or use the coupon code "GODSMAC" when ordering online at Logos.com.

item.title: #49 - Travis Cottrell
item.description: Enjoy the fun interview with singer and worship leader Travis Cottrell! This week we share ways you can have fun using Terminal on the Mac, review Google and Facebook social networking, and conclude with a discussion on our culture and Christmas.
item.itunes:author: Gabe Taviano and Lee Love
item.itunes:subtitle: Enjoy the fun interview with singer and worship leader Travis Cottrell! This week we share ways you can have fun using Terminal on the Mac, review Google and Facebook social networking, and conclude with a discussion on our culture and Christmas.
item.itunes:summary: Enjoy the fun interview with singer and worship leader Travis Cottrell! This week we share ways you can have fun using Terminal on the Mac, review Google and Facebook social networking, and conclude with a discussion on our culture and Christmas.

item.title: #48 - Kary Oberbrunner
item.description: Kary Oberbrunner joins us and discusses his newest book, The Fine Line. We take a look at some of the new and more powerful iPhone applications and conclude by discussing how Christianity is more than just a religion, it's a relationship!
item.itunes:author: Gabe Taviano and Lee Love
item.itunes:subtitle: Kary Oberbrunner joins us and discusses his newest book, The Fine Line. We take a look at some of the new and more powerful iPhone applications and conclude by discussing how Christianity is more than just a religion, it's a relationship!

item.title: #47 - Brent Spore
item.description: Brent joins us and discussed the world of a web designer and reviews how the church is doing with technology. Be sure to check out DigitalDisciples.net! We also review SonicFire Pro and the new MacBook, and conclude with a review of the election.
item.itunes:author: Gabe Taviano and Lee Love
item.itunes:subtitle: Brent joins us and discussed the world of a web designer and reviews how the church is doing with technology. Be sure to check out DigitalDisciples.net! We also review SonicFire Pro and the new MacBook, and conclude with a review of the election.

item.title: #46 - Bart Lewis
item.description: Bart Lewis shares his call to speak to both youth, their pastors and their parents. Join the new God's Mac Prayer Group! A look at podcasting hardware. A look at when a poser takes it a step further, not realizing he / she is betraying Christ.
item.itunes:author: Gabe Taviano and Lee Love
item.itunes:subtitle: Bart Lewis shares his call to speak to both youth, their pastors and their parents. Join the new God's Mac Prayer Group! A look at podcasting hardware. A look at when a poser takes it a step further, not realizing he / she is betraying Christ.
item.itunes:summary: Bart Lewis shares his call to speak to both youth, their pastors and their parents. Join the new God's Mac Prayer Group! A look at podcasting hardware. A look at when a poser takes it a step further, not realizing he / she is betraying Christ.

item.title: #45 - Aaron Marshall and iPods4Africa
item.description: We are partnering with our guest, Aaron Marshall, to challenge our listeners to give at least 20 iPods to educate teachers and leaders in Africa. We also discuss how to record and edit a podcast, and take a look into the life of a Christian poser.
item.itunes:author: Gabe Taviano and Lee Love
item.itunes:subtitle: We are partnering with our guest, Aaron Marshall, to challenge our listeners to give at least 20 iPods to educate teachers and leaders in Africa. We also discuss how to record and edit a podcast, and take a look into the life of a Christian poser.

item.title: #44 - Erwin McManus
item.description: Erwin McManus, pastor of Mosaic Church in Los Angeles, California joins us this week. Reviews and suggestions on various iPhone applications. We conclude by talking with Bart Lewis about today's youth and their relationship with youth leaders and parents.
item.itunes:author: Gabe Taviano and Lee Love
item.itunes:subtitle: Erwin McManus, pastor of Mosaic Church in Los Angeles, California joins us this week. Reviews and suggestions on various iPhone applications. We conclude by talking with Bart Lewis about today's youth and their relationship with youth leaders and parents.

item.title: #43 - Eric Granata
item.description: Entrepreneur and web designer Eric Granata join us this week. A preview of what is to come in the next tutorial series, and a few website and software reviews. An interesting spiritual comparison with "Tar Babies" from the familiar Br'er Rabbit story.
item.itunes:author: Gabe Taviano and Lee Love
item.itunes:subtitle: Entrepreneur and web designer Eric Granata join us this week. A preview of what is to come in the next tutorial series, and a few website and software reviews. An interesting spiritual comparison with "Tar Babies" from the familiar Br'er Rabbit story.

item.title: #42 - Matthew Paul Turner
item.description: Author and speaker, Matthew Paul Turner, joins us this week. Be sure to download a free chapter of his latest book on our site! We focus on the installation process for the Joomla content management system, concluding with a study on "Fighting For Peace".
item.itunes:author: Gabe Taviano and Lee Love
item.itunes:subtitle: Author and speaker, Matthew Paul Turner, joins us this week. Be sure to download a free chapter of his latest book on our site! We focus on the installation process for the Joomla content management system, concluding with a study on "Fighting For Peace".

item.title: #41 - Renee Swope
item.description: Renee Swope, from Proverbs 31 Ministries, join us and discusses how God is working through her and the staff to impact the lives of women. We begin our discussion on using a content management system for websites, and why leaving a legacy is important.
item.itunes:author: Gabe Taviano and Lee Love
item.itunes:subtitle: Renee Swope, from Proverbs 31 Ministries, join us and discusses how God is working through her and the staff to impact the lives of women. We begin our discussion on using a content management system for websites, and why leaving a legacy is important.

item.title: #40 - Rhett & Link
item.description: The hilarious duo from RhettandLink.com join us this week. We surprise a longtime listener from Australia with a phone call and discuss RAW photos. To wrap things up, RevTim joins Gabe and they discuss how to be "Live Today With an Eternal Perspective".
item.itunes:author: Gabe Taviano and Lee Love
item.itunes:subtitle: The hilarious duo from RhettandLink.com join us this week. We surprise a longtime listener from Australia with a phone call and discuss RAW photos. To wrap things up, RevTim joins Gabe and they discuss how to be "Live Today With an Eternal Perspective".
item.itunes:summary: The hilarious duo from RhettandLink.com join us this week. We surprise a longtime listener from Australia with a phone call and discuss RAW photos. To wrap things up, RevTim joins Gabe and they discuss how to be "Live Today With an Eternal Perspective".

item.title: #39 - Fred McKinnon
item.description: A great interview with Fred McKinnon, worship leader at St. Simons Community Church in Georgia and entrepreneur with GetSkinsNow.com. Session two in our technology segment on Better Photography. We close by discussing how to live in the moment.
item.itunes:author: Gabe Taviano and Lee Love
item.itunes:subtitle: A great interview with Fred McKinnon, worship leader at St. Simons Community Church in Georgia and entrepreneur with GetSkinsNow.com. Session two in our technology segment on Better Photography. We close by discussing how to live in the moment.

item.title: #38 - Christian George
item.description: Christian joins us and discusses his newest book, Sex, Sushi & Salvation. Lee kicks off our first technology series by looking at the basics of better photography. Gabe concludes by sharing about his commitment to observing Lent and focusing on the cross.
item.itunes:author: Gabe Taviano and Lee Love
item.itunes:subtitle: Christian joins us and discusses his newest book, Sex, Sushi & Salvation. Lee kicks off our first technology series by looking at the basics of better photography. Gabe concludes by sharing about his commitment to observing Lent and focusing on the cross.
item.itunes:summary: Christian joins us and discusses his newest book, Sex, Sushi & Salvation. Lee kicks off our first technology series by looking at the basics of better photography. Gabe concludes by sharing about his commitment to observing Lent and focusing on the cross.

item.title: #37 - Nick Hamm
item.description: U.S. soldier, Apple employee and God's Mac listener, Nick Hamm, join us this week and gives us an inside look at life in Iraq! We review Fluid, the new site specific browser app for the Mac. This week we also conclude our discussion on the joy of giving.
item.itunes:author: Gabe Taviano and Lee Love
item.itunes:subtitle: U.S. soldier, Apple employee and God's Mac listener, Nick Hamm, join us this week and gives us an inside look at life in Iraq! We review Fluid, the new site specific browser app for the Mac. This week we also conclude our discussion on the joy of giving.
item.itunes:summary: U.S. soldier, Apple employee and God's Mac listener, Nick Hamm, join us this week and gives us an inside look at life in Iraq! We review Fluid, the new site specific browser app for the Mac. This week we also conclude our discussion on the joy of giving.

item.title: #36 - Angela Hunt
item.description: Angela Hunt joins us this week to discuss the most recent of the over 100 books she has authored, as well as her recent switch to the Mac. This week we review the news coming out of the MacWorld Expo and wrap things up with a look at the joy of giving.
item.itunes:author: Gabe Taviano and Lee Love
item.itunes:subtitle: Angela Hunt joins us this week to discuss the most recent of the over 100 books she has authored, as well as her recent switch to the Mac. This week we review the news coming out of the MacWorld Expo and wrap things up with a look at the joy of giving.
item.itunes:summary: Angela Hunt joins us this week to discuss the most recent of the over 100 books she has authored, as well as her recent switch to the Mac. This week we review the news coming out of the MacWorld Expo and wrap things up with a look at the joy of giving.

item.title: #35 - Rob Greenlee
item.description: Rob Greenlee, Microsoft's Zune Podcasting Lead, shares about Microsoft's Zune and podcasting community. A review of the Nikon D3 camera, Remote Buddy and Digital Lifestyle TV. In conclusion, we discuss Christmas being referred to as a happy holiday.
item.itunes:author: Gabe Taviano and Lee Love
item.itunes:subtitle: Rob Greenlee, Microsoft's Zune Podcasting Lead, shares about Microsoft's Zune and podcasting community. A review of the Nikon D3 camera, Remote Buddy and Digital Lifestyle TV. In conclusion, we discuss Christmas being referred to as a happy holiday.
item.itunes:summary: Rob Greenlee, Microsoft's Zune Podcasting Lead, shares about Microsoft's Zune and podcasting community. A review of the Nikon D3 camera, Remote Buddy and Digital Lifestyle TV. In conclusion, we discuss Christmas being referred to as a happy holiday.

item.title: #34 - Mac OS Ken
item.description: Ken Ray, from Mac OS Ken, joins us this week and discusses a wide range of tech topics. Apple has approved the God's Mac web app for the iPhone. We also review how much we've been blessed and look at opportunities we have of being a blessing to others.
item.itunes:author: Gabe Taviano and Lee Love
item.itunes:subtitle: Ken Ray, from Mac OS Ken, joins us this week and discusses a wide range of tech topics. Apple has approved the God's Mac web app for the iPhone. We also review how much we've been blessed and look at opportunities we have of being a blessing to others.
item.itunes:summary: Ken Ray, from Mac OS Ken, joins us this week and discusses a wide range of tech topics. Apple has approved the God's Mac web app for the iPhone. We also review how much we've been blessed and look at opportunities we have of being a blessing to others.

item.title: #33 - Collide Magazine
item.description: Scott McLellan, editor of Collide Magazine, joins us this week and shares how the magazine and staff have come together recently. God's Mac is now on Facebook! A review of the Leopard OS launch and a look at the SuperDuper backup software are included!
item.itunes:author: Gabe Taviano and Lee Love
item.itunes:subtitle: Scott McLellan, editor of Collide Magazine, joins us this week and shares how the magazine and staff have come together recently. God's Mac is now on Facebook! A review of the Leopard OS launch and a look at the SuperDuper backup software are included!
item.itunes:summary: Scott McLellan, editor of Collide Magazine, joins us this week and shares how the magazine and staff have come together recently. God's Mac is now on Facebook! A review of the Leopard OS launch and a look at the SuperDuper backup software are included!

item.title: #32 - AC180.com
item.description: Aaron Conrad, from AC180.com joins us and shares how he and friends are reaching the world for Christ through the use of blog networking. Gabe has enjoyed being a part of the AC180 team - you'll never think of blogging the same after you hear this!
item.itunes:author: Gabe Taviano and Lee Love
item.itunes:subtitle: Aaron Conrad, from AC180.com joins us and shares how he and friends are reaching the world for Christ through the use of blog networking. Gabe has enjoyed being a part of the AC180 team - you'll never think of blogging the same after you hear this!

item.title: #31 - MinistryWeb.org
item.description: An interesting review on the iPod product line and on Lee's iPhone. MinistryWeb.org, the excellent hosting provider of our site and podcast, joins us this week to discuss their great service they do. Do we really believe that God designed us to need rest?
item.itunes:author: Gabe Taviano and Lee Love
item.itunes:subtitle: An interesting review on the iPod product line and on Lee's iPhone. MinistryWeb.org, the excellent hosting provider of our site and podcast, joins us this week to discuss their great service they do. Do we really believe that God designed us to need rest?

item.title: #30 - Mark Graalman
item.description: We jump in on the excitement of the new, powerful, aluminum iMac! Mark Graalman, the only band member of Sanctus Real still using a computer from that other company, hangs out with us and discusses a point in his life that was very challenging.
item.itunes:author: Gabe Taviano and Lee Love
item.itunes:subtitle: We jump in on the excitement of the new, powerful, aluminum iMac! Mark Graalman, the only band member of Sanctus Real still using a computer from that other company, hangs out with us and discusses a point in his life that was very challenging.

item.title: #29 - Chris Rohman
item.description: The iPhone hype is at its peak and we bring you news a week out from launch. Chris Rohman, a guitarist with Sanctus Real, joins us this week to discuss his long-time love for all things Macintosh. Come hear a unique story about defeating sin.
item.itunes:author: Gabe Taviano and Lee Love
item.itunes:subtitle: The iPhone hype is at its peak and we bring you news a week out from launch. Chris Rohman, a guitarist with Sanctus Real, joins us this week to discuss his long-time love for all things Macintosh. Come hear a unique story about defeating sin.
item.itunes:summary: The iPhone hype is at its peak and we bring you news a week out from launch. Chris Rohman, a guitarist with Sanctus Real, joins us this week to discuss his long-time love for all things Macintosh. Come hear a unique story about defeating sin.

item.title: #28 - Stanley Leary
item.description: Photography is of growing interest these days, but how does God want this specific talent and medium to be used? Stanley brings tremendous insight into using the equipment God has blessed Him with to capture moments in a way that will inspire us all.
item.itunes:author: Gabe Taviano and Lee Love
item.itunes:subtitle: Photography is of growing interest these days, but how does God want this specific talent and medium to be used? Stanley brings tremendous insight into using the equipment God has blessed Him with to capture moments in a way that will inspire us all.
item.itunes:summary: Photography is of growing interest these days, but how does God want this specific talent and medium to be used? Stanley brings tremendous insight into using the equipment God has blessed Him with to capture moments in a way that will inspire us all.

item.title: #27 - KJ 52
item.description: New father and recent winner of two Dove awards, KJ 52, joins us and opens our eyes to the world of Christian rap. KJ stands strong after the world has tried to hold him back, and has come out on top once again with his latest album, The Yearbook.
item.itunes:author: Gabe Taviano and Lee Love
item.itunes:subtitle: New father and recent winner of two Dove awards, KJ 52, joins us and opens our eyes to the world of Christian rap. KJ stands strong after the world has tried to hold him back, and has come out on top once again with his latest album, The Yearbook.

item.title: #26 - This Beautiful Republic
item.description: The new godsmac.com site is live! This Beautiful Republic joins us as they head out on their first big tour. They are now in the top 10 list of Christian albums on iTunes! Listener Martha shares how the God's Mac community helped her win a contest!
item.itunes:author: Gabe Taviano and Lee Love
item.itunes:subtitle: The new godsmac.com site is live! This Beautiful Republic joins us as they head out on their first big tour. They are now in the top 10 list of Christian albums on iTunes! Listener Martha shares how the God's Mac community helped her win a contest!
item.itunes:summary: The new godsmac.com site is live! This Beautiful Republic joins us as they head out on their first big tour. They are now in the top 10 list of Christian albums on iTunes! Listener Martha shares how the God's Mac community helped her win a contest!

item.title: #25 - Ara Derderian
item.description: Welcome to our Silver Anniversary week on the podcast! In this week's technology segment we cover the new Mac Pro, a useful spam filter, and coloring your folders on the Mac. Ara Derderian from the HDTV podcast at htguys.com joins us this week.
item.itunes:author: Gabe Taviano and Lee Love
item.itunes:subtitle: Welcome to our Silver Anniversary week on the podcast! In this week's technology segment we cover the new Mac Pro, a useful spam filter, and coloring your folders on the Mac. Ara Derderian from the HDTV podcast at htguys.com joins us this week.
item.itunes:summary: Welcome to the Silver anniversary episode! Three new Get A Mac video ads Update on iPods for all Michigan students Apple keyboard with Scroll Wheel Question from listener Software Pick of the Week Sieve spam filter Apple Tip of the Week Colored Folders Contest of the Week Vote for Martha - photo #6 on Room 2 Bloom Artist of the Week is "Love Addict" by Family Force 5 Visit Family Force 5 on the web Ara Derderian - HDTV Podcast Apple TV vs. Mac mini in the living room Remote Buddy Plasma vs. LCD DirecTV DVR hdtvpodcast@mac.com Intermission song is "Future Impact" by Visual Cliff Undisciplined Consumption of Media - Proverbs 4:20-27 You are what you eat Prayer Time Pray for listener Jon and his wife, as they are anxiously awaiting their child's birth Pray for Lee's friend - details shared in the podcast We'd love to hear from you this week at www.godsmac.com/forum Contact us on the web at www.godsmac.com, by sending an email to gabe@godsmac.com or on the phone at 614-259-1598.

item.title: #24 - Nick Champlin
item.description: Apple gives the Mac Pro a boost. An encouraging week on the forum. Our weekly contest is back with a unique twist! Nick Champlin gives us an interesting view on the resurrection of Christ as we celebrate His death, burial and resurrection this weekend!
item.itunes:author: Gabe Taviano and Lee Love
item.itunes:subtitle: Apple gives the Mac Pro a boost. An encouraging week on the forum. Our weekly contest is back with a unique twist! Nick Champlin gives us an interesting view on the resurrection of Christ as we celebrate His death, burial and resurrection this weekend!
item.itunes:summary: TECHNOLOGY Update from Gabe and Lee Update on the forum Mac Pro 8-core and quad-core workstation Apple discounts cinema displays iPod saves! iPods for all Michigan students Software Pick of the Week SoundSource Mac Tip of the Week Removing menu applications / System volume changes Contest of the Week Google's free TiSP broadband service Artist of the Week is "The One" by Stephanie Cuomo. As well as a singer / songwriter, she is also the Frontline (young adult ministry) worship director at McLean Bible Church in McLean, Virginia. MEETS Nick Champlin Macintosh background Ministries you are involved with: Senior pastor at First Christian Church in Clearwater, FL Nigeria-Ijaw Mission The Light-Washed Path Devotionals ToneFest You may contact Nick using the email address to the right ETERNITY Nick Champlin stays with us for this segment and helps us focus on the resurrection Prayer Time Nick's daughter-in-law, Harumi, has been diagnosed with a rare brain disease. Also pray for Nick, and his wife Kathy, as they are traveling to Japan to visit their son Sam, and Harumi this week. Pray for listener Jon and his wife, as they are anxiously awaiting their child's birth God's Mac - praise for a very encouraging first week back last week!

item.title: #23 - Lee Love
item.description: Christian Musician Radio is a unique mix of nationally known and up and coming independent Christian artists. Christian Musician Radio is a community of musicians and music lovers who are dedicated to sharing the Gospel around the world.
item.itunes:author: Gabe Taviano
item.itunes:subtitle: Christian Musician Radio is a unique mix of nationally known and up and coming independent Christian artists. Christian Musician Radio is a community of musicians and music lovers who are dedicated to sharing the Gospel around the world.
item.itunes:summary: TECHNOLOGY Member of the Tech Podcasts network Our forum is live!!! Adobe Creative Suite 3 Publish same content in multiple places Integration between applications Layers maintained between Flash and Photoshop Apple TV at Best Buy HTGuys.com Podcast Mac Tip of the Week - One app maximized Intermission music is "Red Tree" by Falling Echoes MEETS Lee Love Gabe is a new listener What is Christian Musician Radio? How did you get started? The music The audience Example of demographics The future Website and plans How may the listeners get in touch with you? Prayer request from Lee Pray that God gives Lee strength and guidance with various ministries Also that God might bring people to assist Lee with CMR Closing song is "Thank You For Today" by Phil Keaggy ETERNITY In the world, but not of the world Prayer Time Gabe's Dad - received news today that he has diabetes Praise for Neal from episode 22 - God is moving God's Mac - for the weekly episodes to continue and listeners to enjoy the new forum

item.title: #22 - Eugene Ware
item.description: Eugene's great experience and bright future with video over the web and into your living room will inspire you. Come hear what God is doing in Australia and across the globe in some of the newest technologies. Eugene also discusses his new video podcast.
item.itunes:author: Gabe Taviano
item.itunes:subtitle: Eugene's great experience and bright future with video over the web and into your living room will inspire you. Come hear what God is doing in Australia and across the globe in some of the newest technologies. Eugene also discusses his new video podcast.
item.itunes:summary:
Technology Photoshop CS3 Beta Test Results HP outselling Dell USB rechargeable batteries Mac Tip of the Week - PhotoBooth Gmail is now free without a referral Intermission music is News Flash by Verbs
Meets Eugene Ware Eugene's websites Online video - compared to TV in the 1960s How did you get started in the IT field? Discuss video Discuss Snob Free Coffee podcast Amazon Unbox movie downloads service Custom Flix VisualHub - automatic video format splitter for the Mac How may the listeners get in touch with you or hear more from you? Do you have a prayer request you would like for us to take with us this week? Pray for Eugene as he searches for the most effective ways to be utilizing his talents to glorify the Lord. Closing song is Pursue Me by Jason Holdridge. CD available on Jason's website.
Eternity Prayer Time Jon - pray for his direction as he has a desire to serve the Lord as his vocation, and also the relationships God has just given him at his current job. A recent opportunity came up there to be a disciple to an unbeliever. Neal - pray for he and his wife as they are following the Lord and where He would want them to go. Pray that God will make clear what and where He wants Neal and his family. Closing Contact us on the web at www.godsmac.com, by sending an email to gabe@godsmac.com or on the phone at 614-259-1598.

item.title: #21 - Emery Wang
item.description: Emery claims to have been a Christian in the past, and attempts to define how he has since separated himself from God. Did Emery lose his religion or his relationship? Was the relationship ever there, or is it possibly still quietly there today?
item.itunes:author: Gabe Taviano
item.itunes:subtitle: Emery claims to have been a Christian in the past, and attempts to define how he has since separated himself from God. Did Emery lose his religion or his relationship? Was the relationship ever there, or is it possibly still quietly there today?
item.itunes:summary:
MEETS Emery Wang Proving atheism to be false wouldn't prove Christianity to be true. Absolute truth Atheism or agnosticism? Is atheism even possible? You cannot know all evidence for or against God, therefore you cannot say there is no evidence for God. You could claim that there is no gold in China, but the claim could not be proven to be true unless you have searched the entire country yourself. Pink unicorns / Screaming Blue Ants. Do children need punished for doing wrong? Focusing on God only being good (flood, disaster, etc.) seems to hide that. He is also righteous and just? Good isn't good without righteousness. Losing religion vs. losing a relationship Persecution is inevitable for true Christianity (Paul writing to Timothy - 2 Timothy 3:12)
CLOSING Prayer Requests Pray for Emery and other atheists, as they continue to attempt at proving God to be useless in their lives. Also pray that we may be more bold, relying on God to show us how to love them Contact us on the web at www.godsmac.com, by sending an email to gabe@godsmac.com or on the phone at 614-259-1598.

item.title: #20 - Gary
item.description: Gary joins us for his first week as the co-host on the podcast! We're excited about the future of the podcast and added value that Gary will bring to God's Mac. We discuss many of the new improvements that we are building into version two of the website.
item.itunes:author: Gabe Taviano
item.itunes:subtitle: Gary joins us for his first week as the co-host on the podcast! We're excited about the future of the podcast and added value that Gary will bring to God's Mac. We discuss many of the new improvements that we are building into version two of the website.
item.itunes:summary:
Technology Introducing Gary as our new co-host Cisco almost loses six year trademark to iPhone Godsmac.com Version 2 Forum for communication with listeners Blog and Podcasts intertwined and separate Unique Flash podcast player - surprise in the future! Google Calendar integrated into design of site Friends of God's Mac - yellow pages directory Search functionality for all content on site Much, much more.... Contest for free CD and t-shirt / suggest a design for the new godsmac.com website Music is "Breathe Into Me" by Red
MEETS Gary Location Family How Gary and I met Web design Future of podcast Music is "Already Over" by Red
ETERNITY Poem - Roll Of The Dice Study - Atheism to Christianity Deceptive philosophy Understanding as the foundation of atheism
CLOSING Prayer Requests Pray for Gary's wisdom as he joins the show and encouragement as we make an effort to provide our listeners with more service through our podcast. Contact us on the web at www.godsmac.com, by sending an email to gabe@godsmac.com or on the phone at 614-259-1598.

item.title: #19 - GateSeven Media Group
item.description: Andrew, with GateSeven Media Group, shares how God is using their staff to assist ministries and businesses with web design and services at the same time. This week we focus on how easily idolatry is taking hold in our lives, and ways to guard our faith.
item.itunes:author: Gabe Taviano
item.itunes:subtitle: Andrew, with GateSeven Media Group, shares how God is using their staff to assist ministries and businesses with web design and services at the same time. This week we focus on how easily idolatry is taking hold in our lives, and ways to guard our faith.
item.itunes:summary:
TECHNOLOGY Sidestep the Macworld hype and focus on that in the eternity segment Marla's book, "Is That All He Thinks About" - purchase online Thanks to Andy from Germany! New website and possible new co-host! ModBook - Macworld Best of Show 2007 Cisco and Apple iPhone trademark battle Mac Tip of the Week - Expose Contest for free CD Music is "O Praise Him" by the David Crowder Band
MEETS GateSeven Media Group - Andrew Vanderploeg - Chief Communications Officer Introduce Electricurrent Introduce Bark Communications Mac or PC? How did you come to know the Lord and how were you led to work there? Are the technologies different between Electricurrent and Bark? How do you market yourselves? As a staff, how do you keep the focus on Christ as a group? What exciting projects are currently in the mix? Toronto Maple Leafs Alpha Canada Are you personally challenged or inspired by certain individuals or ministries? Which ways do you personally see God at work through technology? (Eastpoint Community Church - new members from website) Contacting and working with GateSeven Media Group Do you have a prayer request you would like for us to take with us this week? Growth and wisdom in dealing with ministry and corporate clients Music is "Run" by my favorite band - Kutless. Song is on self-titled album.
ETERNITY Poem - Call Waiting Study - Idolatry Maybe in the form of anything Becoming a friend to the world means hating God What blessing are we missing? What's the first step we should take? Why do people today hate being bored? The real issue I believe centers around what we do when we are given time. Everyone can adjust their schedule. Making time is not the problem. The problem we all have is that in order to put our faith into practice we must come to terms that God is God - priority number one. What if we had to keep our other gods a secret? My challenge to you is that God is well worth being excited about. There's nothing else that desires our praise like He does! CLOSING Prayer Requests Pray for GateSeven Media Group as the transition from a small to medium organization, and with the decisions in working with businesses and ministries. Take time this week to cover yourselves in prayer - challenge yourself to review the idols in your life. Contact us on the web at www.godsmac.com, by sending an email to gabe@godsmac.com or on the phone at 614-259-1598.

item.title: #18 - A Christian and An Atheist
item.description: You will hear agreement and disagreement from both sides as we cover issues of morality, parenthood, adultery, homosexuality, intelligence, etc. We are not looking to prove an answer right away, but to come to a better understanding with time.
item.itunes:author: Gabe Taviano
item.itunes:subtitle: You will hear agreement and disagreement from both sides as we cover issues of morality, parenthood, adultery, homosexuality, intelligence, etc. We are not looking to prove an answer right away, but to come to a better understanding with time.
item.itunes:summary: MEETS Emery Wang and Norton Herbst Background and purpose of your podcast Give me a few topics you both see yourself disagreeing on the most and why? Do you give your children rules and expect them to obey? By marrying someone are we simply sharing life or do we find ourselves fulfilled when with someone else? What are your beliefs in adultery? Homosexuality is obviously an abomination in God's eyes, how do you see it? Leviticus 20:13 and Romans 1:27 Have you found meaning in life without any point of reference or assistance? What do you take from the global response of Christianity over time? Richard Dawkins (Wired magazine) is saying that atheism is a movement, with near 30 million non-religious people in the US. Why hasn't it grown until recently? Why do atheists, like Dawkins, believe Christians are less intelligent? Dawkins seems angered that an atheist hasn't and couldn't get elected to Congress? Albert Einstein - "Uncertainty Principle" was God does not play dice - Science without religion is lame, religion without science is blind. Galileo Galilei - I do not feel obliged to believe that the same God who has endowed us with sense, reason, and intellect has intended us to forgo their use. CLOSING Prayer Requests Pray for Christians to not shy away from discussion or sharing their faith. Contact us on the web at www.godsmac.com, by sending an email to gabe@godsmac.com or on the phone at 614-259-1598.

item.title: #17 - Chris Christensen
item.description: Chris Christensen informs us of his two podcasts from Silicon Valley. A study on the Pope's Christmas message on worshiping God and not technology. The poem and wallpaper downloads this week focus on the topic of worship as well. Have a safe New Year!
item.itunes:author: Gabe Taviano
item.itunes:subtitle: Chris Christensen informs us of his two podcasts from Silicon Valley. A study on the Pope's Christmas message on worshiping God and not technology. The poem and wallpaper downloads this week focus on the topic of worship as well. Have a safe New Year!
item.itunes:summary:
TECHNOLOGY Google Earth review Writing first article for Christian Computing Magazine this week Mac Tip of the Week - One Click Dock Trick Music is "Devil is Prowling" by our guest this week, Chris Christensen. Download available on his website.
MEETS Chris Christensen How did you become interested in technology? Did Apple computers interest you from the beginning? What were some of the projects you were able to work on while at Apple? How did you get started in podcasting? Discuss Amateur Traveler's Podcast / now on Sirius satellite radio Discuss The Bible Study Podcast Pope's Christmas message this week - focusing on worshiping God and not technology? How has technology been a hindrance and a help to your walk with the Lord? Chris discusses a free tool for you - daily Bible chapters in your inbox! Besides listening to your podcast, what are some ways the listeners can support you? Online Store / Jesus Saves t-shirt Do you have a prayer request you would like for us to take with us this week? Pray for Chris's future decisions and the God to continue to guide him. Closing song by Chris is title Amen and can be downloaded on his website
ETERNITY Pope's Christmas message - worship God not technology Accomplishments vs. humility Poem - worship God
Study - worship God not technology Do we really worship technology? Just using it because we can / no focus on having a purpose Think about what we don't have before being more thankful for what we do Aimlessly curious about new products Debt is fine / instant gratification
Simple steps to gain control over the problem Review what you already have and new ways to use it Take time each day to thank God for what He's blessed you with Take a step of faith and challenge your tithing before looking to spend more Like Chris mentioned - allow the computer to feed your faith using scripture
CLOSING Prayer Requests Pray for Chris Christensen's future decisions and God's guidance. Pray for my wife Marla as her new book is coming out on January 7th. That she is not ashamed of the courage it took to write on such a delicate issue in today's culture. Pray for me as I write the first article for Christian Computing Magazine. I really feel like God wants to speak through me there as well as here on the podcast. Contact us on the web at www.godsmac.com, by sending an email to gabe@godsmac.com or on the phone at 614-259-1598.

item.title: #16 - Livi and Ava Taviano
item.description: My two oldest daughters join us this week and share a look at Christmas from a kid's point of view. Come hear how they have prepared to celebrate the birth of Christ! They have an exciting review on a movie, some great tips on gift and activity ideas.
item.itunes:author: Gabe Taviano
item.itunes:subtitle: My two oldest daughters join us this week and share a look at Christmas from a kid's point of view. Come hear how they have prepared to celebrate the birth of Christ! They have an exciting review on a movie, some great tips on gift and activity ideas.
item.itunes:summary:
TECHNOLOGY Are you girls excited to be on the podcast? Do you remember the name of our podcast? Livi and Ava have brought their computers with them this week to the podcast. Discuss the technology behind the Christmas lights in a Columbus neighborhood synchronized to music on the radio. Livi and Ava just sent their first emails this week. Hear how they think email works. Music is "God with us" on the Do You See What I See album by Todd Agnew. Available on iTunes. Check out Paul's website! Purchase the album or songs on iTunes by clicking the iTunes link to the right.
MEETS Discuss Christmas with Livi and Ava. What are some things you girls have done to get ready for Christmas? What kind of gifts do you think you are getting this Christmas? What do you think Mommy wants for Christmas? What do you think of santa claus? You girls have been counting down the days until Christmas. How many do we have left?
ETERNITY Discuss the birth of Jesus with Livi and Ava Do you think people get more excited about their own birthday or Jesus' birthday?You girls went and watched The Nativity Story with Mommy yesterday. What was your favorite part? What did you learn from the movie? Do you want to watch it again?
CLOSING Prayer Requests Ton, a listener from the Philippines, has a 10 year-old son named John. Pray for Ton as he encourages John with his studies. It's so evident during Christmas of the things that this world offers that distract from important things, like studies, your faith, and enjoying time with your family.Pray for dear friends of one of our listeners here in Ohio. They just gave birth to a child that has Downs syndrome. A praise was sent it to thank God the baby made it through birth, but a request for the family as well, as they adjust in the future. Contact us on the web at www.godsmac.com, by sending an email to gabe@godsmac.com or on the phone at 614-259-1598.

item.title: #15 - Roger and Angi Courville
item.description: Roger and Angi Courville share how If God could save that train wreck then maybe theres hope for me. Sylvester Stallone shares the power of Christ inside of the new Rocky Balboa movie. A study how, as Christians, we have to have the Eye of the Tiger.
item.itunes:author: Gabe Taviano
item.itunes:subtitle: Roger and Angi Courville share how If God could save that train wreck then maybe theres hope for me. Sylvester Stallone shares the power of Christ inside of the new Rocky Balboa movie. A study how, as Christians, we have to have the Eye of the Tiger.
item.itunes:summary:
TECHNOLOGY - Notes available starting with this episode! - Interact through the week by joining our Google Group - also accessible from our website. - Podlinez.net - Listen to our most recent episode via telephone - (818) 688-2730 is our number. - Adobe Photoshop CS3 Beta available 12/15/06 - definite download for Intel Mac users. - Adobe Kuler - real-time color theme generator. - Snow Globe - available by clicking the Gift 4 You icon on our website. - Music is "Your Love Never Changes" on the Fly Away album by Paul Wright. Available on iTunes. Check out Paul's website!
MEETS - Roger and Angi Courville - If God could save that train wreck then maybe theres hope for me. That's how many see the testimony of Roger and Angi. God doesn't give up on us no matter where we are. Be sure to visit their website and let them know how they have encouraged you personally. - You are not alone in whatever it is you are going through, and they would love to hear from you! If you know of someone who is going through a time with drugs, thoughts of divorce, an abortion or an affair, please pass any of these websites along to them!
ETERNITY - Rocky interview - Visit the Rocky Resources website for great promotional material for the movie and more audio clips from Sylvester Stallone. - We want to thank Motive Marketing for allow us to share pieces of the Rocky Balboa interview with you and for providing suc great promotional material- Visit the official website for the Rock Balboa movie - in theaters across the nation on 12/22/06. - 2 Timothy 4:7 - Poetry and Paper (Eye of the Tiger)
CLOSING - Prayer Requests - Praise for Martha our Switchin' Granny Geek - brain surgery for trigeminal neuralgia. It was a success and the doctors also ended up curing a mass of arteries and veins (called an AVM) through another surgical procedure. Continue to pray for Martha for sure! - Contact us on the web at www.godsmac.com <http://www.godsmac.com/>, by sending an email to gabe@godsmac.com <mailto:gabe@godsmac.com> or on the phone at 614-259-1598.

item.title: #14 - Peter Fokos
item.description: Peter and Digital Praise have created excellent Christian computer games and dance pads. Everyone on the podcast gets a free snowglobe! Our study this week is on not living a legalistic life of faith, but one with a focus on love.
item.itunes:author: Gabe Taviano
item.itunes:subtitle: Peter and Digital Praise have created excellent Christian computer games and dance pads. Everyone on the podcast gets a free snowglobe! Our study this week is on not living a legalistic life of faith, but one with a focus on love.
item.itunes:summary: Technology meets eternity - reviewing why most things we admire greatly have no lasting value, but when used as a tool that can bring glory to God it can have eternal impact. Check out www.godsmac.com or call 614-259-1598 to let us know what you think!
